 Review comment:
   We can store credential with `actions/checkout@v2`: https://github.com/actions/checkout/tree/v2
   
   It means that we can use `git push origin ...` instead of `git push https://${{github.actor}}:${{secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN}}@github.com/...`.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

nealrichardson commented on issue #6411: ARROW-7801: [R][CI] Add lint and doc GitHub Action workflows
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6411#issuecomment-587606017
 
 
   > > I'd rather see a CI entry that fails if the man pages weren't updated.
   >
   > I think that we need it too.
   > 
   > @nealrichardson Could you also add it too?
   
   The CI jobs we already have will fail if the man pages don't match the code. 
   
   > Anyway, this will be useful to generate consistent man pages. (I'm not sure that generated man pages may depend on environment.)
   
   They shouldn't.
   
   Since there seems to be some difference of opinion as to whether this is a good idea, I'll open a thread on the mailing list before proceeding.

nealrichardson commented on pull request #6932: ARROW-7801: [R][CI] Add lint and doc GitHub Action workflows
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6932
 
 
   #6411 tried to do this work automatically, but some were uncomfortable with that; this version instead is triggered by adding a PR comment "autotune".
   
   Currently only the R documentation is triggered, but it's set up to be pluggable, to trigger build steps if certain file/patterns are changed, and then everything is committed and pushed together.
   
   Since `issue_comment` workflows are only run off the master branch, I tested this by merging these commits to master on my fork and triggering it on a PR there. See https://github.com/nealrichardson/arrow/pull/2#issuecomment-613138356
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

bkietz commented on pull request #6932: ARROW-7801: [R][CI] Add lint and doc GitHub Action workflows
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6932#discussion_r409655611
 
 

 ##########
 File path: .github/workflows/comment_bot.yml
 ##########
 @@ -53,5 +53,72 @@ jobs:
           archery trigger-bot \
             --event-name ${{ github.event_name }} \
             --event-payload ${{ github.event_path }}
-
-
+  autotune:
+    name: "Fix all the things"
+    if: startsWith(github.event.comment.body, 'autotune')
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - uses: r-lib/actions/pr-fetch@master
+        with:
+          repo-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
+      - name: See what is different
+        run: |
+          set -ex
+          git remote add upstream https://github.com/apache/arrow
+          git fetch upstream
+          changed() {
+            git diff --name-only HEAD^..upstream/master | grep -e "$1" >/dev/null 2>&1
+          }
+          if changed '^r/.*\.R$'; then
+            echo "::set-env name=R_DOCS::true"
+          fi
+          if changed 'cmake' || changed 'CMake'; then
+            echo "::set-env name=CMAKE_FORMAT::true"
+          fi
+          if changed '^cpp/src'; then
+            echo "::set-env name=CLANG_FORMAT_CPP::true"
+          fi
+          if changed '^r/src'; then
+            echo "::set-env name=CLANG_FORMAT_R::true"
+          fi
+      - name: Run cmake_format
+        if: false
+        # if: env.CMAKE_FORMAT == 'true' || endsWith(github.event.comment.body, 'everything')
 
 Review comment:
   Debug code?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

fsaintjacques commented on pull request #6932: ARROW-7801: [R][CI] Add lint and doc GitHub Action workflows
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6932#discussion_r409729205
 
 

 ##########
 File path: .github/workflows/comment_bot.yml
 ##########
 @@ -53,5 +53,72 @@ jobs:
           archery trigger-bot \
             --event-name ${{ github.event_name }} \
             --event-payload ${{ github.event_path }}
-
-
+  autotune:
+    name: "Fix all the things"
+    if: startsWith(github.event.comment.body, 'autotune')
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - uses: r-lib/actions/pr-fetch@master
+        with:
+          repo-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
+      - name: See what is different
+        run: |
+          set -ex
+          git remote add upstream https://github.com/apache/arrow
+          git fetch upstream
+          changed() {
+            git diff --name-only HEAD^..upstream/master | grep -e "$1" >/dev/null 2>&1
+          }
+          if changed '^r/.*\.R$'; then
+            echo "::set-env name=R_DOCS::true"
+          fi
+          if changed 'cmake' || changed 'CMake'; then
+            echo "::set-env name=CMAKE_FORMAT::true"
+          fi
+          if changed '^cpp/src'; then
+            echo "::set-env name=CLANG_FORMAT_CPP::true"
+          fi
+          if changed '^r/src'; then
+            echo "::set-env name=CLANG_FORMAT_R::true"
+          fi
+      - name: Run cmake_format
+        if: false
+        # if: env.CMAKE_FORMAT == 'true' || endsWith(github.event.comment.body, 'everything')
+        run: |
+          python3 -m pip install -r dev/archery/requirements-lint.txt
+          python3 run-cmake-format.py
+      - name: Run clang-format on cpp
+        if: env.CLANG_FORMAT_CPP == 'true' || endsWith(github.event.comment.body, 'everything')
+        run: |
+          . .env # To get the clang version we use
+          cpp/build-support/run_clang_format.py \
+              --clang_format_binary=clang-format-${CLANG_TOOLS} \
+              --exclude_glob=cpp/build-support/lint_exclusions.txt \
+              --source_dir=cpp/src --quiet --fix
+      - name: Run clang-format on r
+        if: env.CLANG_FORMAT_R == 'true' || endsWith(github.event.comment.body, 'everything')
+        run: |
+          . .env # To get the clang version we use
+          cpp/build-support/run_clang_format.py \
+              --clang_format_binary=clang-format-${CLANG_TOOLS} \
+              --exclude_glob=cpp/build-support/lint_exclusions.txt \
+              --source_dir=r/src --quiet --fix
+      - uses: r-lib/actions/setup-r@v1
+        if: env.R_DOCS == 'true' || endsWith(github.event.comment.body, 'everything')
+      - name: Update R docs
+        if: env.R_DOCS == 'true' || endsWith(github.event.comment.body, 'everything')
+        shell: Rscript {0}
+        run: |
+          source("ci/etc/rprofile")
+          install.packages(c("remotes", "roxygen2"))
+          remotes::install_deps("r")
+          roxygen2::roxygenize("r")
+      - name: Commit results
+        run: |
+          git config user.name "$(git log -1 --pretty=format:%an)"
+          git config user.email "$(git log -1 --pretty=format:%ae)"
+          git commit -a -m 'Autoformat/render all the things [automated commit]' || echo "No changes to commit"
+      - uses: r-lib/actions/pr-push@master
 
 Review comment:
   There's no action from the base library that does this?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

+          cpp/build-support/run_clang_format.py \
+              --clang_format_binary=clang-format-${CLANG_TOOLS} \
+              --exclude_glob=cpp/build-support/lint_exclusions.txt \
+              --source_dir=r/src --quiet --fix
+      - uses: r-lib/actions/setup-r@v1
+        if: env.R_DOCS == 'true' || endsWith(github.event.comment.body, 'everything')
+      - name: Update R docs
+        if: env.R_DOCS == 'true' || endsWith(github.event.comment.body, 'everything')
+        shell: Rscript {0}
+        run: |
+          source("ci/etc/rprofile")
+          install.packages(c("remotes", "roxygen2"))
+          remotes::install_deps("r")
+          roxygen2::roxygenize("r")
+      - name: Commit results
+        run: |
+          git config user.name "$(git log -1 --pretty=format:%an)"
+          git config user.email "$(git log -1 --pretty=format:%ae)"
+          git commit -a -m 'Autoformat/render all the things [automated commit]' || echo "No changes to commit"
+      - uses: r-lib/actions/pr-push@master
 
 Review comment:
   Not afaik, not yet.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Like https://github.com/r-lib/actions/tree/master/examples#render-readme. 

* If changes to r/README.Rmd, render readme
* If changes to r/R, render docs
* If changes to r/src, lint.sh --fix
fields.summary: [Developer] Add issue_comment workflow to fix lint/style/codegen
